Articles.Content:
This is not a game project but I really wanna share it.

Spent about six months to finish my own trading bot. And now it shows such result as +5% per month (at real account). This is my little victory.
Now I have a huge temptation to make it my business.

Trading as in stock market?

5% per month is huge. Well done.
Trading as in currency market. Thanks!

Oh.

Can you give us more details? How do you deal with conversion fees?

For example, if I went to my bank and, using todays exchange rates, converted 1000 € into USD I'd get $1077,49.

If I converted those $1077,49 back I'd end up with 924,08 €.

That's perhaps a bit exaggerated and I could get better rates outside the bank, but the principle applies, doesn't it?

Is the buy/sell automated, or do you have to do it manually?

Edited May 20, 2019 by Shpaget

Exchange rate is much lower at the moment of bid.

You are talking about daily range of EURUSD pair. You have bought it at highest daily price and sold at lowest one, the bank includes this difference in its fee. At Forex, you may buy at lowest one and sell at highest but to perform this you should be very lucky or educated. Some people consider that Forex is kind of casino just because the luck can help you to win.

Buy/sell is generally manual but the bot I made is automated. It makes tiny bids on EURUSD pair, I have wins and losses in here but wins are higher than losses. The risk is minimal and I am proud of it.

But I can not recommend you to play on Forex because it's very risky.

Edited May 20, 2019 by Luch

Oh, I didn't buy. I just used their exchange rates to calculate the fees.

You're right. I'm not trading, since I don't consider myself good enough to make money

Just out of curiosity. You say the graph in first post is from a real account. What are the axis on the graph? How long did you let the bot trade?

27 minutes ago, Shpaget said:

Just out of curiosity. You say the graph in first post is from a real account. What are the axis on the graph? How long did you let the bot trade?

One year. X axis is order amount, Y is money, from 10000 cents to about 15900. So that's 59% per year.

On 5/19/2019 at 9:52 PM, Luch said:

Now I have a huge temptation to make it my business.

but ...

there always a but ... 

you should apply what you just learned here https://www.noaa.gov/ for example instead of adding to the current exchange market kerfuffle mess ...

"did i ever mentionned somewhere i hate when none able to  self-rescript meta-algorythm and "n"-dimensionnal-statistic&proba are applied to little selfish profit ?"

EDIT:
buy rice that season in china, sell rice that season in africa & etc. of that kind ... whats the point , may i ask ? found the graal, graal not just a trap @timescale over a few bipeds lifespan ...

edit2:
 

Spoiler



 

Edited June 10, 2019 by WinkAllKerb''
1659 1751 1781 lalalala & *grumpf*

I am very concerned of giving something good to others. That's why I had no selfish profit for years, even a little one.
Being modest and devote ourselves to science, charity, or something equal is very good. But this doesn't work as we think. I worked as a volunteer, I've lost some funds, and I did almost nothing.
To make significant changes in the world, we need to be significant, too. And in 21th century it starts from our own software, new business, our independence at least.

Why do people work? To pay for a rent, to pay for medical services and education of family members, to buy some food. Ignoring this causes bad results, I mean, for example I was needed to pay big money to save the life of my wife and now I need to think how to handle it. I can't say that some part of the world (for example, financial) is bad and we should get rid of it. But I am not a person that loves money only. This is just my first successful project in that sphere but also I love art, gaming, and science very much. If somebody will give me $20k saying "stop your tries to survive and do what you love", I will surely return to my lovely game development. This is, like, a question of that extra $20k.

edit2:
 

  Reveal hidden contents

I have to say it

 

 

STONKS

STONKS

So, the news. Current bot build makes solid 10% per month. My testers are happy.

But the real reason for me to make a new post is this cool picture

Looks nice.

What's the difference between the two?

3 hours ago, Shpaget said:

Looks nice.

What's the difference between the two?

Thank you :3

Green Bot is a bot with wide settings and parameters with all possibilities to make risky experiments, and Night Bot is the main trading strategy with low risks.

Green Bot:

Night Bot:

Looks promising.

Have you worked out your business strategy?

8 hours ago, Shpaget said:

Looks promising.

Have you worked out your busines﻿s strategy? ﻿

Only about 20% of the strategy is mine, remaining 80% is the compilation of known strategies so this is not a 100% new idea. But it works and this is the most important fact.

On 7/27/2019 at 11:05 PM, Luch said:

My testers are happy.

Is that live or simulated trading?

11 hours ago, Shpaget said:

Is that live or simulated trading?

Live trading indeed. They already gain about $1000 and that's the only reason why I decided to tell something about my bots.

Trading is risky and this is my best success for now. Maybe now you see the very start of my IT product. I don't know.

I do not know if I revived this post or not, but please forgive me I just wanted to congratulate you for having and achieving such great results in trading with 5% per month, good job! I lost my job and was without money for a very long time. Soon I started looking for other ways to make money online and realized that working as a CFDs trader is a great idea. At first, I doubted a lot, but then I began to spend as much time as possible studying trading and I realized that it was a very profitable and profitable business. I found a great trading platform investous.com and now I only work on it and it is super cool and convenient.

Edited November 29, 2020 by huilonah
